scripts.COMMENT01: Some npm scripts target a platform (i.e. the JS module ecosystem),
scripts.COMMENT09: MODULE_PLATFORM  What                 Bindings  Found In               NOTES
scripts.COMMENT11: src              master ES6 source    ES        src/*.js               DEFAULT (when platform is omitted)
scripts.COMMENT16: all              all of the above                                      APPLICABLE to npm scripts ONLY
scripts.COMMENT17: The on/for nomenclature helps disambiguate the difference between (for example):
scripts.COMMENT18: - test:all:    which identifies WHICH tests to run (i.e. all tests)
scripts.COMMENT19: - test:on:all: which identifies WHICH platform to run tests on (i.e. all platforms)
scripts.start:COMMENT: start ... convenience script to initiate development process
scripts.dev:COMMENT: dev ... launch development processes in parallel (continous build/test)
scripts.build:COMMENT1: build ... bundle executable resources for publication
scripts.build:COMMENT2: base 'build' script is same as build:for:bundle
scripts.build:for:COMMENT: build:for:{platform} ... bundle executable resources on specified module platform (documented above)
scripts.build:for:bundle: cross-env BABEL_ENV=commonjs NODE_ENV=development          npm run build
scripts.build:for:bundle.min: cross-env BABEL_ENV=commonjs NODE_ENV=production           npm run build
scripts.build:for:lib: cross-env BABEL_ENV=commonjs      babel src --out-dir lib --ignore spec
scripts.build:for:es: cross-env BABEL_ENV=es            babel src --out-dir es --ignore spec
scripts.test:COMMENT1: test ... run unit tests ... lib: published library tests, samples: sample code tests, all: all tests (DEFAULT)
scripts.test:COMMENT2: base 'test' script is same as build:on:src
scripts.test:on:COMMENT: test:on:{platform} ... run ALL tests on specified module platform (documented above)
scripts.test:on:all: npm-run-all test:on:src test:on:bundle test:on:bundle.min test:on:lib  test:on:es
scripts.lint:COMMENT: lint ... verify code quality NOTE: This lints both production and test code; real-time linting is also accomplished through our webpack bundler!
scripts.clean: npm run build:clean && npm run docs:clean
